request.description:
Use the `OpportunityCreate` method to create a new opportunity in the database.

NOTE: You must run the `AbEntryCreate (Company)` request before running this one so that the `AbEntryKey` environment variable is set.

body.raw:
{  
   "Token":"{{Token}}",
   "Opportunity":{  
      "Data":{  
         "Key":null,
         "AbEntryKey":"{{AbEntryKey}}",
         "ContactKey": "Q29udGFjdAkxODA1MjMyNTIyMjc1ODM1NDAwMDFDCTE=",
         "Objective":"Example",
         "Description":"This is an example opportunity.\nIt was created using Maximizer.Web.Data in Postman!",
         "Status":2,
         "Cost":1234.56,
         "ForecastRevenue":2345.67,
         "ActualRevenue": 2345.60,
         "StartDate":"2018-01-01",
         "CloseDate":"2018-01-01",
         "Creator": "VXNlcglBTUlOQg==",
         "CreationDate": "2018-01-01",
         "ModifiedBy": "VXNlcglBTUlOQg==",
         "LastModifyDate": "2018-01-01",
         "Leader": "VXNlcglBTUlOQg==",
         "SalesTeam": "U2FsZXNUZWFtCTY1NTM1",
         "ReadOnly": false,
         "SalesProcessKey": null,
         "CurrentSalesStageKey": null,
         "Comment": "Test",
         "Reason": "0",
         "Rating": ["57998"],
         "Category": ["15"],
         "Product": ["20"]
        }
   }
}

request.description:
Use the `OpportunityCreate` method to create a new opportunity in the database.

NOTE: You must run the `AbEntryCreate (Company)` request before running this one so that the `AbEntryKey` environment variable is set.
Use the `OpportunityRead` method to search for opportunities in the database.
Use the `OpportunityRead` method to search for opportunities in the database.
Use the `OpportunityRead` method to search for opportunities in the database.

Use the `Read` method to query the data of ColumnSetup objects in the database. This hasn't been implement yet as of 3/23/2018 but one it has you can add "Columns" to the Read request to retreive the list.

"Columns":[{              
                        
                      "FieldKey":1,
                      "Header":1,
                      "Template":1,
                      "Width":1,
                      "AlignH":1
                      }]

Use the `OpportunityUpdate` method to update an existing opportunity in the database.

NOTE: You must run the `OpportunityCreate` request *before* running this one so that the `OpportunityKey` environment variable is set.

Use the `OpportunityDelete` method to delete an opportunity from the database.

NOTE: You must run the `OpportunityCreate` request *before* running this one so that the `OpportunityKey` environment variable is set.
Use the `SchemaRead` method to query the structure or metadata of entities in the database.
Use the `OpportunityGetFieldOptions` method to retrieve the options for table-valued fields of Opportunity objects.

Use the `OpportunityGetFieldOptions` method to retrieve the options for table-valued fields of Opportunity objects. If you include the Key of an existing Opportunity, the options specific to that entry are retrieved.

NOTE: You must run the `OpportunityCreate` request *before* running this one so that the `OpportunityKey` environment variable is set.

exec: // This script checks to see if there is a valid token in
// the environment before making any requests to the API
// by calling the TokenValid method. If there is already a
// valid token, it does nothing. If there is no token or if
// the token is not valid, it attempts to obtain a new one
// by calling the Authenticate method, and if successful,
// saves the token to the environment.
// Get the API URL and check to make sure it is non-empty
console.error("The BaseURL environment variable is not set.");
// We don't want to do this when calling the Authenticate or
// TokenValid methods, since the purpose of those methods is
// to call the very methods that we're calling below
// Check to see if there is already a Token in the environment variable
// If there is a Token, see if it is still valid
// If there is no Token, just call Authenticate
console.info("Checking to see if token is valid...");
// Send the TokenValid request to the API
// Handles the TokenValid method response, and calls the
// Something went wrong when trying to call the API
console.error("An error occurred when trying to call the TokenValid method.");
// Check to see if the method was successful
// The token is not valid, so we will try to get a new one.
console.info("Token is missing or invalid; requesting a new one...");
// Check to see if the VendorId and AppKey are set, and if
// they are, add them to the request.
// Send the Authenticate request to the API
// Handles the Authenticate method response and stores the
// new token in the "Token" environment variable.
console.error("An error occurred when trying to call the Authenticate method.");
// Store the new token in the environment variable
// so that we can use it in subsequent requests
// A nonzero Code means that there was an error
console.error("Authentication failed. Check the credentials in the environment.");
